p: A study reported that the most common coping strategies used by healthcare workers included acceptance of the critical situation and use of a positive outlook while working ( Wong et al., 2005). Likewise, Khalid et al. (2016) outlined that a positive attitude in the workplace had the biggest impact in reducing staff stress. It was noted that healthcare workers may be inadequately prepared and supported to cope with stressors and this negatively affected working environment ( Healy and Tyrrell, 2011). During particularly stressful situations, the most used strategies by clinicians were maintaining a normal life, thinking about solutions, maintaining situational control and information seeking ( Xu et al., 2019). Among the resources used to deal with major life events, religion and social support have been suggested to represent adaptive coping strategies ( Imperatori et al., 2020; Martínez et al., 2020).
